content: the last continue to slip_stitch join the brim and head section the same way ensuring that you are evenly joining the same stitch from both ends of the work continue joining up to the top of the beanie place a sm in your working loop so you don t lose your last stitch and turn the joined tube right side out now you can start shaping the top section on the rs the beanie lying flat rs the beanie folded in half right side facing towards each other wrong side facing you on the outside ws 10 the sassy scrappy beanie by off the hook creative ©2025 top of beanie right side out round 1 rs ch1 decrease all around the top at the end of each row around the beanie your number of single_crochet sts made will equal half the number of row you have made i e child size = 52sc around adult size = 56sc around slsl into first single_crochet chain 2 do not turn work round 1 & 2 along the top of the beanie rs round 2 rs starting in the same stitch of ch2 decrease all around this will decrease the top end of your hat again by half the number of decrease you created in round 1 i e child size = 26st around adult size = 28sts around slip_stitch into the top of ch2 fasten_off leaving a nice long tail with a darning needle stitch loosely into the front loop of each st all around the top of the hat alternating direction of stitching i e work up under the front loop of st and then back down under the front loop of the next st once you have stitched all around the top pull the yarn end gently closing the top of the hat completely sew in the end tightly to secure the closing if you are adding a pompom use the yarn end to sew it or a button to attach a faux fur pompom elastic into place securely fasten_off and sew in ends fold up the brim in half if you would prefer you could permanently secure the brim folded up with a few random stitches around the edges of the brim or you can leave the brim as is and adjust folding it how you like it while wearing it 11 the sassy scrappy beanie by off the hook creative ©2025 congratulations you have successfully made something so cool out of all those scraps woohoo please share and tag me in on all your sassy scrappy beanie
